subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Spiritual But Not Religious: The New Mystics
description: A micro-lesson that makes Spiritual But Not Religious: The New Mystics usable.

hook.text: 'I'm spiritual but not religious.' One in four Americans says this. They want the experience without the institution.

buildup.text: The 'nones' are the fastest growing religious group. They reject organized religion but hunger for meaning and purpose.

discovery.text: They meditate, do yoga, read Rumi, and feel awe in nature. They're modern mystics without a tradition to hold them.

twist.text: Critics call it shallow cherry-picking. Supporters call it honest: taking what works, leaving what doesn't.

climax.text: The 'spiritual but not religious' movement is mysticism democratized. No gatekeepers. No dogma. Just raw experience.

punchline.text: Spiritual but not religious: mysticism with no gatekeepers. Freedom or drift?

quiz.question: What defines the 'spiritual but not religious' movement?
options: Seeking spiritual experience and meaning outside of organized religion
